intro: Vieusseuxia intermedia, commonly known as the common lousewort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes various parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a fibrous root system and often forms dense colonies in its habitat.
